title: Developing Reflective Thinking Skills in Problem-Based Learning Environments: Mathematical Modeling Projects

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Collaboration Tools via Smartphones Integrated with Weekly Seminars and Feedback Sessions

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze their thinking processes by writing reflective journals and receiving peer feedback while solving real-world math problems.
Learners enhance their ability to compare and evaluate peers' problem-solving strategies during group discussions and propose creative alternatives.
Learners can assess their learning process and derive improvement strategies by utilizing reflective questions at each project stage.

resources: Smartphone-Compatible Collaboration Platform (e.g., Google Workspace, Notion)
Structured Questionnaire for Reflective Thinking Promotion
Digital Portfolio Template for Weekly Feedback Management
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
